original_text: The α-ω-aminohexylcarbamate derivative of cyanocobalamin was prepared using a method described previously [18]. Briefly, solid CDI (260mg, 0.32mmol) was added to cyanocobalamin (1.0g, 0.148mmol) previously dissolved in anhydrous dimethyl sulfoxide. The mixture was stirred for up to 2h at 30°C, followed by the addition of dry 1,6-hexanediamine (314mg, 0.54mmol) and stirring of the mixture at room temperature over 24h. The mixture was poured into ethyl acetate (30ml) and left to stand. Following centrifugation and decanting of the supernatant, the residue was sonicated for 5min in acetone (50ml). The resulting precipitate was filtered and the solid washed in acetone. The crude product was purified by silica column chromatography (45% v/v 2-propanol, 30% v/v n-butanol, 2% v/v ammonia and 25% v/v water) followed by lyophilisation.
original_translation: El derivado de α-ω-aminohexilcarbamato de cianocobalamina fue preparado utilizando un método descrito previamente [18]. Breve, se añadió CDI sólido (260 mg, 0.32 mmol) a cianocobalamina (1.0 g, 0.148 mmol) previamente disuelta en dimetilsulfóxido anhidro. La mezcla se agitó durante hasta 2 horas a 30°C, seguido por la adición de 1,6-hexanodiamina seca (314mg, 0.54mmol) y agitación de la mezcla a temperatura ambiente durante 24 horas. La mezcla se vertió en acetato de etilo (30 ml) y se dejó reposar. Tras la centrifugación y decantación del sobrenadante, el residuo se sonicó durante 5 minutos en acetona (50 ml). El precipitado resultante fue filtrado y el sólido lavado con acetona. El producto crudo fue purificado por cromatografía en columna de sílice (45% v/v de 2-propanol, 30% v/v de n-butanol, 2% v/v de amoníaco y 25% v/v de agua) seguido de liofilización.
original_sentences: The α-ω-aminohexylcarbamate derivative of cyanocobalamin was prepared using a method described previously [18].
Briefly, solid CDI (260mg, 0.32mmol) was added to cyanocobalamin (1.0g, 0.148mmol) previously dissolved in anhydrous dimethyl sulfoxide.
The mixture was stirred for up to 2h at 30°C, followed by the addition of dry 1,6-hexanediamine (314mg, 0.54mmol) and stirring of the mixture at room temperature over 24h.
The mixture was poured into ethyl acetate (30ml) and left to stand.
Following centrifugation and decanting of the supernatant, the residue was sonicated for 5min in acetone (50ml).
The resulting precipitate was filtered and the solid washed in acetone.
The crude product was purified by silica column chromatography (45% v/v 2-propanol, 30% v/v n-butanol, 2% v/v ammonia and 25% v/v water) followed by lyophilisation.

Briefly, solid CDI (260mg, 0.32mmol) was added to cyanocobalamin (1.0g, 0.148mmol) previously dissolved in anhydrous dimethyl sulfoxide.
The mixture was stirred for up to 2h at 30°C, followed by the addition of dry 1,6-hexanediamine (314mg, 0.54mmol) and stirring of the mixture at room temperature over 24h.
The mixture was poured into ethyl acetate (30ml) and left to stand.
Following centrifugation and decanting of the supernatant, the residue was sonicated for 5min in acetone (50ml).
The resulting precipitate was filtered and the solid washed in acetone.

The crude product was purified by silica column chromatography (45% v/v 2-propanol, 30% v/v n-butanol, 2% v/v ammonia and 25% v/v water) followed by
lyophilisation
.

lyophilisation.translated_text:
El derivado de α-ω-aminohexilcarbamato de cianocobalamina fue preparado utilizando un método descrito previamente [18]. Breve, se añadió CDI sólido (260 mg, 0.32 mmol) a cianocobalamina (1.0 g, 0.148 mmol) previamente disuelta en dimetilsulfóxido anhidro. La mezcla se agitó durante hasta 2 horas a 30°C, seguido por la adición de 1,6-hexanodiamina seca (314mg, 0.54mmol) y agitación de la mezcla a temperatura ambiente durante 24 horas. La mezcla se vertió en acetato de etilo (30 ml) y se dejó reposar. Tras la centrifugación y decantación del sobrenadante, el residuo se sonicó durante 5 minutos en acetona (50 ml). El precipitado resultante fue filtrado y el sólido lavado con acetona. Output: El producto crudo fue purificado por cromatografía en columna de sílice (45% v/v 2-propanol, 30% v/v n-butanol, 2% v/v amoníaco y 25% v/v agua) seguido de
liofilización
.
